TITLE: Liz Truss’ Woes Multiply After Media Blitz
SUMMARY: In a round of interviews, the prime minister showed little sympathy for the pain that high interest rates could inflict on mortgage holders, critics said.

TITLE: August PCE Inflation Data Shows Prices Are Stubbornly High
SUMMARY: Inflation stayed far above the Federal Reserve’s goal in August, as prices climbed more quickly than economists expected.

TITLE: U.S. Economy Weaker Than Thought in Year’s First Half, by One Measure
SUMMARY: Gross domestic income, adjusted for inflation, grew more modestly than first estimated. Unlike gross domestic product, though, it remained positive.

TITLE: Britain’s Gamble on Tax Cuts has Economists Warning of Past Mistakes
SUMMARY: Liz Truss, Britain’s new prime minister, defended her plan in the face of stiff criticism from the International Monetary Fund and others.

TITLE: Why the British Pound Continues to Sink
SUMMARY: The Bank of England had to step in Wednesday after markets deemed a new government economic plan unwise, but the pound has been on a longer slide.

TITLE: Protests in Prague Signal a Troubled Winter Ahead in Europe
SUMMARY: Tens of thousands gathered in the Czech capital for the second such protest in a month, spurred by an energy crisis and rising prices that are affecting countries across Europe.

TITLE: To Calm Markets, Bank of England Will Buy Bonds on ‘Whatever Scale Is Necessary’
SUMMARY: The purchases are designed “to restore orderly market conditions,” the central bank said, after days of turmoil that followed the government’s plan for sweeping tax cuts and higher borrowing.

TITLE: The Long Road to Driverless Trucks
SUMMARY: Self-driving eighteen-wheelers are now on highways in states like California and Texas. But there are still human “safety drivers” behind the wheel. What will it take to get them out?

TITLE: Three Charts That Illustrate America’s Political and Economic Malaise
SUMMARY: Scott Galloway chronicles a decades-long crisis using graphs, data and some provocative hypotheses.

TITLE: Inflation Has Hit Tenants Hard. What About Their Landlords?
SUMMARY: Publicly traded corporate landlords are reporting some of their highest margins ever, while smaller operators say rent increases are eaten up by costs.

TITLE: Strong Dollar Is Good for the US but Bad for the World
SUMMARY: The Federal Reserve may have no choice but to wage a relentless inflation fight, but countries rich and poor are feeling the pain of plunging currencies.

TITLE: Factory Jobs Are Booming Like It’s the 1970s
SUMMARY: U.S. manufacturing is experiencing a rebound, with companies adding workers amid high consumer demand for products.

TITLE: Central Banks Raise Interest Rates, Fearing Worse Pain Later
SUMMARY: Federal Reserve officials and their counterparts around the world are trying to defeat inflation by rapidly raising interest rates. They know it will come at a cost.

TITLE: The Fed Intensifies Its Battle Against Inflation
SUMMARY: Federal Reserve officials made another large rate increase and signaled more to come, pledging to quash inflation despite expected pain.

TITLE: Regulators Accuse Amazon of Singling Out Union Organizers for Discipline
SUMMARY: National Labor Relations Board officials said the company had applied its workplace rules unfairly, and asked it to change or scrap the regulations.

TITLE: How to Read the Fed’s Projections Like a Pro
SUMMARY: Yes, the Federal Reserve raised rates on Wednesday. But Wall Street is focused on what the Fed has planned for the rest of this year and beyond.

TITLE: How a Looming Oil Ban Could Devastate a Small Italian City
SUMMARY: Italy’s largest refinery, owned by Russia’s Lukoil, has lost financing because of sanctions. Now, it faces the cutoff of its crude supply, putting thousands of jobs at risk.

TITLE: How the Car Market Is Shedding Light on a Key Inflation Question
SUMMARY: How easily companies give up swollen profits could determine how easily the Federal Reserve can cool inflation. Dealerships offer clues.

TITLE: Egypt Feels Pain of Global Disruptions Wrought by War and Pandemic
SUMMARY: The country’s economy has been very hard hit by cascading crises which have disrupted worldwide trade.

TITLE: What Comes Next in the Fed’s Fight Against Inflation?
SUMMARY: Wall Street will watch the central bank’s economic forecasts closely on Wednesday, when another jumbo-size rate increase is expected.
